cultural_sites.name: Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic (Dalada Maligawa)
cultural_sites.significance: Houses the relic of the tooth of the Buddha. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and the most sacred Buddhist site in Sri Lanka.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Temple of the Tooth

cultural_sites.name: Jaya Sri Maha Bodhiya
cultural_sites.significance: The southern branch of the historical Sri Maha Bodhi tree in India under which the Buddha attained Enlightenment. It is the oldest continually documented tree in the world.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Jaya Sri Maha Bodhiya

cultural_sites.name: Nallur Kandaswamy Kovil
cultural_sites.significance: One of the most significant Hindu temples in Sri Lanka, dedicated to Lord Murugan. Known for its Dravidian architecture and annual festival.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Nallur Kovil

cultural_sites.name: St. Anthony's Shrine, Kochchikade
cultural_sites.significance: A major Catholic national shrine and minor basilica dedicated to Saint Anthony of Padua, attracting devotees of all faiths for miracles and blessings.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of St. Anthony's Shrine

cultural_sites.name: Sigiriya Rock Fortress
cultural_sites.significance: An ancient rock fortress and palace built by King Kashyapa. Famous for its frescoes, 'Lion Gate', and sophisticated hydraulic systems. A UNESCO World Heritage Site.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Sigiriya

cultural_sites.name: Dambulla Cave Temple (Rangiri Dambulla)
cultural_sites.significance: The largest and best-preserved cave temple complex in Sri Lanka, featuring over 150 statues of the Buddha and detailed cave paintings. A UNESCO World Heritage Site.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Dambulla Cave Temple

cultural_sites.name: Ruwanwelisaya Stupa
cultural_sites.significance: One of the *Solosmasthana* (16 sacred sites) and one of the largest stupas in the world, built by King Dutugemunu. A towering symbol of ancient Buddhist architecture.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Ruwanwelisaya

cultural_sites.name: Old Town of Galle and its Fortifications
cultural_sites.significance: A fortified city built by the Portuguese and extensively modified by the Dutch. It's the best-preserved sea fort in South Asia and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Galle Fort

cultural_sites.name: Sri Pada (Adam's Peak)
cultural_sites.significance: A sacred mountain containing the 'Sri Pada' (sacred footprint), revered by Buddhists (Buddha's footprint), Hindus (Shiva's), and Muslims/Christians (Adam's or St. Thomas's).
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Adam's Peak

cultural_sites.name: Ruhunu Maha Kataragama Dewalaya
cultural_sites.significance: A shrine complex dedicated to Skanda-Murukan, attracting devotees from all major religions (Buddhist, Hindu, Muslim) for centuries, highlighting inter-faith harmony.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Kataragama Kovil

cultural_sites.name: Jami-Ul-Alfar Mosque (Red Mosque)
cultural_sites.significance: An iconic, historic mosque known for its striking red-and-white striped architecture. A major landmark in the Pettah market area.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Jami-Ul-Alfar Mosque

cultural_sites.name: Gangaramaya Temple
cultural_sites.significance: One of Colombo's most important temples, combining architecture from Sri Lanka, India, China, and Thailand. Also features a museum with historical artifacts.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Gangaramaya Temple

cultural_sites.name: Dutch Reformed Church (Groote Kerk)
cultural_sites.significance: Located inside Galle Fort, it is one of the oldest Protestant churches still in use in Sri Lanka, built in 1755, featuring unique gravestones and architecture.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Dutch Reformed Church Galle

cultural_sites.name: Ancient City of Polonnaruwa
cultural_sites.significance: The second ancient capital of Sri Lanka. Features well-preserved ruins of royal palaces, temples, and the famous 'Gal Vihara' rock-cut Buddha statues. A UNESCO World Heritage Site.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Polonnaruwa Gal Vihara

cultural_sites.name: Seetha Amman Temple
cultural_sites.significance: Dedicated to Sita, the wife of Lord Rama, it is believed to be the site where she was held captive by King Ravana in the epic Ramayana.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Seetha Amman Kovil

cultural_sites.name: Mihintale
cultural_sites.significance: The site where Buddhism was officially introduced to Sri Lanka by Arahant Mahinda in 247 BC. Features many stupas and ancient cave dwellings on a sacred mountain.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Mihintale

cultural_sites.name: Isurumuniya Vihara
cultural_sites.significance: A beautiful ancient Buddhist temple known for its rock carvings, including the famous 'Isurumuniya Lovers' and the 'Elephant Pond' carvings.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Isurumuniya

cultural_sites.name: Muthiyangana Raja Maha Viharaya
cultural_sites.significance: One of the *Solosmasthana*, believed to be a place visited by the Buddha. Located in the heart of Badulla town, it is a significant regional pilgrimage site.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Muthiyangana Vihara

cultural_sites.name: National Basilica of Our Lady of Lanka
cultural_sites.significance: A major Catholic site and the national basilica, dedicated to Our Lady of Lanka. Known for its grand architecture and large pilgrimages.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of National Basilica

cultural_sites.name: Sri Maha Kali Amman Kovil
cultural_sites.significance: A prominent and colorful Hindu temple dedicated to the goddess Kali, known for its vibrant architecture and intense, powerful atmosphere.
cultural_sites.image_url: PLACEHOLDER: Licensed image of Trincomalee Kali Kovil
